title: Goblins in Runeterra?!
body:
So, playing Ornn...since he's meta now. He has a quote "_The Freljord forges men out of... whatever children are. Dirt, goblins_." Based off his tone, it could be a metaphor to maybe the idea of "goblins" a fantasy term in their world for a make believe fairy tale creature, or he is actually referring to real goblins. Only other evidence i have is in the Demolisher Nunu splash art, there is clearly goblins being thrown about, figured this art isn't canon or anything but the fact they are there makes me wonder. 

Could Ornn, or the concept of goblins, be referring to what could've been yordles? 

{{sticker:sg-janna}} 
I just wanna know for my League based DnD campaign!
I already made up "Feral Yordes" to fill in that goblin/kobold void.

replies.body: During Kled's development he was noted as "almost a goblin" (or something to that effect), so it's very likely that "goblin" is just a term for yordles, particularly feral ones. I highly doubt we get a solid answer on this for a good while, so honestly just go with your headcanon.

I get why someone would say that, but from the fantasy standpoint, Yordles are so extremely different from Goblins. It's like comparing Goblins to Gnomes or Dwarves. I think it would be cool if Riot added some more.

meh, I think your limiting the definition of goblin here the the post-Tolkien, D&D definition.    In development we frequently tend to go back much further than that. (Often to pre-christian folk-tales and myths.)      Arguably Yordles relate to Gnomes, brownies, dwarves and goblins, leprechauns et all.       That said. I've always loved gobbos, grots, goblins , kobalts, and all the other little nasties. So I agree it would be cool.

Given that {{champion:105}} is also a Yordle now, wouldn't it be reasonable to assume the door is open to more species of Yordles of all sorts? Or would you rather Goblins, Kobalts and the like, remained their own species if they were ever added to the lore?

I can't speak to Orrn's quote.  But Originally Edmundo and I intended Kled to be runeterra's version of a goblin.    I had a weird little story, and Mundo had a sweet drawing of a goblin like creature with a crown and another one that was very fuzzy and similar to Kled (but riding a beetle) -- Both images were super inspiring.   I believe we had also just sort of assumed a "goblin" was just how humans described and saw an evil yordle though.   (Much like the lore use of Spirit vs Demon in language use.)    
But our producer (PO)  pushed us to make Kled more normal Yordle looking, and reluctantly we did.
If you don't mind me asking. What is the direction for future Yordles?
Sorry. Donno.  Not on my plate.  I think that sort of thing is decided by the IP council.  (Various producers and leads across various products).
Might be a strange question but why is that something decided by producers and not writers?

I feel like there is a big disconnect from what you guys think Yordles are and what the community that likes them want. I like Goblins but Goblins are not Yordles. If that inspired Kled, great, fantastic. I think Kled is a fantastic representation of a more modern Male Yordle. And what we see in Legends of Runeterra also looks good. But I'm worried about the physical nature of them. We want them to be a physical race on par with the Vastaya.
I could easily see goblins as a relative to trolls(or just as a term for troll children) in which case it'd make sense for them to be in the freljord since trolls are also living there.
In game quotes and alternate skinlines flirt with being canon, but aren't officially.

I tried making a League of Legends D&D homebrew once.

After several hours of writing up different races, nations, finding a map that someone made, etc. Riot made another big lore retcon (I can't even remember which one) and I just hung up the towel.
Here's what I had so far in case you're interested but the vast majority of it is outdated sooo...
https://www.dandwiki.com/wiki/Runeterra_(5e_Campaign_Setting)

I'm actually confused about when you wrote this.
You mention Azir and the Institute of War in this, but Azir was only released after the institute of war was retconned from the lore.

Since the map had the Institute of War on it, I was trying to re-write them as an independent mages guild or something. Granted it probably would have been easier if I just scrapped them entirely but that was the only map of Runeterra I could find (as this was before Camille).

> Only other evidence i have is in the Demolisher Nunu splash art, there is clearly goblins being thrown about, figured this art isn't canon or anything but the fact they are there makes me wonder.

Demolisher Nunu & Willump are part of the Rift Quest skin line, which is heavily referencing Tabletop RPG games like D&D. It would be kinda ironic if you start using Goblins in your campaign because of that.
